units.title: Seeding AF cells in Matrigel and culturing
units.text: To investigate formation of AFOs we seeded viable AF cells in Matrigel droplets and cultured them in an ad hoc-defined generic epithelial medium without tissue-specific signals (Supplementary Table 3).
units.rationale: Describes the initial step to generate organoids from amniotic fluid cells.

units.title: Establishing clonal AFO lines
units.text: To establish clonal lines, individual AFOs were picked, dissociated into single cells and replated (Fig. 2a,b and d).
units.rationale: Provides the procedure for deriving clonal organoid cultures.

units.title: Immunostaining for epithelial identity and mesenchymal exclusion
units.text: We confirmed the AFO’s epithelial identity by staining for pan-epithelial markers (EpCAM, ECAD and pan-cytokeratin) and showing absence of the mesenchymal marker platelet-derived growth factor receptor α (PDGFRα).
units.rationale: Specifies markers used to verify epithelial nature of organoids.

units.title: Assessing proliferation and apoptosis by immunostaining
units.text: Immunostaining confirmed cell proliferation (Ki67) and lack of apoptosis (cleaved caspase 3) within AFOs (Fig. 2f).
units.rationale: Details the assay to evaluate cell health in organoids.

units.title: Evaluating epithelial polarity
units.text: Epithelium is polarized as demonstrated by basolateral integrin β4 (ITGβ4), apical F-actin and zonula occludens-1 (ZO-1)-positive tight junctions (Fig. 2g).
units.rationale: Shows how polarity of the organoid epithelium is assessed.

units.title: Intestinal ring formation assay for SiAFOs
units.text: Three hours after seeding, SiAFOs started fusing; by day 2 a more complex tubular budding structure had formed with full ring maturation at day 10.
units.rationale: Describes the time‑course of the intestinal ring formation experiment.

units.title: EdU incorporation to detect proliferating cells
units.text: 5-ethynyl-2'-deoxyuridine (EdU) incorporation indicated cell proliferation at the SiAFO crypt base (Fig. 3a).
units.rationale: Provides a method to label proliferating cells in the organoid crypt.

units.title: Bulk RNA sequencing of clonal AFO lines
units.text: We then conducted bulk RNA sequencing to investigate the tissue lung (n = 6), kidney (n = 4), bladder (n = 1) and placenta (n = 1; Fig. 1e).
units.rationale: Outlines the transcriptomic profiling step for organoid identity.

units.title: Single‑cell sequencing of AF epithelial cells
units.text: Using single-cell sequencing, we investigated human AF epithelial cells (AFEpCs), highlighting that these originate from multiple developing tissues.
units.rationale: Describes the high‑resolution profiling of amniotic fluid epithelial cells.

units.title: Flow cytometry sorting of live epithelial cells
units.text: Representative flow cytometry analysis of EpCAM (n = 58,964 cells) and ECAD (CDH1, n = 38,389 cells) (PI) and positive for Hoechst.
units.rationale: Specifies the cell‑sorting strategy to isolate viable epithelial cells.
